017
018package org.tquadrat.foundation.util;
019
020import static java.util.Locale.ROOT;
021import static org.apiguardian.api.API.Status.STABLE;
022import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.CommonConstants.UTF8;
023import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects.requireNonNullArgument;
024
025import java.io.File;
026import java.io.IOException;
027import java.io.Serializable;
028import java.math.BigInteger;
029import java.nio.charset.Charset;
030import java.nio.file.Path;
031import java.security.MessageDigest;
032import java.util.Arrays;
033import java.util.zip.Checksum;
034
035import org.apiguardian.api.API;
036import org.tquadrat.foundation.annotation.ClassVersion;
037import org.tquadrat.foundation.util.internal.HashImpl;
038
039/**
040 *  <p>{@summary The definition for a wrapper around hash values of any kind.}
041 *  These hashes are often used as checksums to validate the integrity of files
042 *  or messages.</p>>
043 *
044 *  @version $Id: Hash.java 1045 2023-02-07 23:09:17Z tquadrat $
045 *  @extauthor Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
046 *  @UMLGraph.link
047 *  @since 0.1.1
048 */
049@SuppressWarnings( "NewClassNamingConvention" )
050@ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: Hash.java 1045 2023-02-07 23:09:17Z tquadrat $" )
051@API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.1" )
052public sealed interface Hash extends Cloneable, Serializable
053    permits HashImpl
054{
055        /*-----------*\
056    ====** Constants **========================================================
057        \*-----------*/
058
059        /*---------*\
060    ====** Methods **==========================================================
061        \*---------*/
062    /**
063     *  Returns the hash as an array of bytes.
064     *
065     *  @return The hash value.
066     */
067    public byte [] bytes();
068
069    /**
070     *  Creates and returns a copy of this object.
071     *
072     *  @return The copy of this instance.
073     */
074    public Hash clone();
075
076    /**
077     *  Creates the hash for the given byte array, using the given algorithm.
078     *
079     *  @param  data    The input data.
080     *  @param  algorithm   The algorithm
081     */
082    public static Hash create( final byte [] data, final Checksum algorithm )
083    {
084        return HashImpl.create( data, algorithm );
085    }   //  create()
086
087    /**
088     *  Creates the hash for the given String, using the given algorithm.
089     *
090     *  @param  data    The input data.
091     *  @param  algorithm   The algorithm
092     */
093    public static Hash create( final CharSequence data, final Checksum algorithm )
094    {
095        return create( data, UTF8, algorithm );
096    }   //  create()
097
098    /**
099     *  Creates the hash for the given String, using the given algorithm.
100     *
101     *  @param  data    The input data.
102     *  @param  encoding    The encoding for the String.
103     *  @param  algorithm   The algorithm
104     */
105    public static Hash create( final CharSequence data, final Charset encoding, final Checksum algorithm )
106    {
107        return HashImpl.create( requireNonNullArgument( data, "data" ).toString().getBytes( requireNonNullArgument( encoding, "encoding" ) ), algorithm );
108    }   //  create()
109
110    /**
111     *  Creates the hash for the given file, using the given algorithm.
112     *
113     *  @param  data    The input data.
114     *  @param  algorithm   The algorithm
115     *  @throws IOException Problems to process the file.
116     */
117    public static Hash create( final File data, final Checksum algorithm ) throws IOException
118    {
119        return create( requireNonNullArgument( data, "data" ).toPath(), algorithm );
120    }   //  create()
121
122    /**
123     *  Creates the hash for the given file, using the given algorithm.
124     *
125     *  @param  data    The input data.
126     *  @param  algorithm   The algorithm
127     *  @throws IOException Problems to process the file.
128     */
129    public static Hash create( final Path data, final Checksum algorithm ) throws IOException
130    {
131        return HashImpl.create( data, algorithm );
132    }   //  create()
133
134    /**
135     *  Creates the hash for the given byte array, using the given algorithm.
136     *
137     *  @param  data    The input data.
138     *  @param  algorithm   The algorithm
139     */
140    public static Hash create( final byte [] data, final MessageDigest algorithm )
141    {
142        return HashImpl.create( data, algorithm );
143    }   //  create()
144
145    /**
146     *  Creates the hash for the given String, using the given algorithm.
147     *
148     *  @param  data    The input data.
149     *  @param  algorithm   The algorithm
150     */
151    public static Hash create( final CharSequence data, final MessageDigest algorithm )
152    {
153        return create( data, UTF8, algorithm );
154    }   //  create()
155
156    /**
157     *  Creates the hash for the given String, using the given algorithm.
158     *
159     *  @param  data    The input data.
160     *  @param  encoding    The encoding for the String.
161     *  @param  algorithm   The algorithm
162     */
163    public static Hash create( final CharSequence data, final Charset encoding, final MessageDigest algorithm )
164    {
165        return HashImpl.create( requireNonNullArgument( data, "data" ).toString().getBytes( requireNonNullArgument( encoding, "encoding" ) ), algorithm );
166    }   //  create()
167
168    /**
169     *  Creates the hash for the given file, using the given algorithm.
170     *
171     *  @param  data    The input data.
172     *  @param  algorithm   The algorithm
173     *  @throws IOException Problems to process the file.
174     */
175    public static Hash create( final File data, final MessageDigest algorithm ) throws IOException
176    {
177        return create( requireNonNullArgument( data, "data" ).toPath(), algorithm );
178    }   //  create()
179
180    /**
181     *  Creates the hash for the given file, using the given algorithm.
182     *
183     *  @param  data    The input data.
184     *  @param  algorithm   The algorithm
185     *  @throws IOException Problems to process the file.
186     */
187    public static Hash create( final Path data, final MessageDigest algorithm ) throws IOException
188    {
189        return HashImpl.create( data, algorithm );
190    }   //  create()
191
192    /**
193     *  Creates an instance of {@code Hash} from the given byte array.
194     *
195     *  @param  hashValue   The hash value.
196     */
197    public static Hash from( final byte [] hashValue ) { return new HashImpl( hashValue ); }
198
199    /**
200     *  Creates an instance of {@code Hash} from the given String.
201     *
202     *  @param  hashValue   The hash value.
203     */
204    public static Hash from( final CharSequence hashValue ) { return HashImpl.from( hashValue ); }
205
206    /**
207     *  Returns this hash as a number.
208     *
209     *  @return The number.
210     */
211    public default BigInteger number() { return new BigInteger( bytes() ); }
212
213    /**
214     *  Validates whether the given hash value matches with this hash instance.
215     *
216     *  @param  hashValue   The hash value to test.
217     *  @return {@code true} if the hash value matches with this hash instance,
218     *      {@code false} otherwise.
219     */
220    public default boolean validate( final byte [] hashValue ) { return Arrays.equals( bytes(), hashValue ); }
221
222    /**
223     *  Validates whether the given hash value matches with this hash instance.
224     *
225     *  @param  hashValue   The hash value to test.
226     *  @return {@code true} if the hash value matches with this hash instance,
227     *      {@code false} otherwise.
228     */
229    public default boolean validate( final long hashValue ) { return number().longValue() == hashValue; }
230
231    /**
232     *  Validates whether the given hash value matches with this hash instance.
233     *
234     *  @param  hashValue   The hash value to test.
235     *  @return {@code true} if the hash value matches with this hash instance,
236     *      {@code false} otherwise.
237     */
238    public default boolean validate( final CharSequence hashValue )
239    {
240        return toString().toLowerCase( ROOT )
241            .equals( requireNonNullArgument( hashValue, "hashValue" ).toString().toLowerCase( ROOT ) );
242    }   //  validate()
243}
244//  interface Hash
245
246/*
247 *  End of File
248 */
